2025.description: RSS Feed consuming and rendering following a tutorial.  Had to look up how to truncate a string with JS.  Had to look up how to regex out html tags in the description tag for xml.  I learned that dev.to has RSS feeds for users without CORS, so I used one of them.

2024.description: Sliders to return an RGB CSS String.
Sliders to return an RGBA CSS String again.  This time with styled input range.

Camille Mormal Portfolio Clone.  Uses Dialog / Modal and @starting-style to animate the showing of modal.  Readdresses the issue of the Dialog / Modal not being full screen without Max-Width or Max-Height being set.

Instagram Profile Page with Camille Mormal Nav Bar.  Uses Dialog / Modal and @starting-style to animate the showing of modal.  ISSUE: Stuggled with getting the Modal to translate from off the page to on the page.  It seems translateY(50vh) works but translateY(100vh) from bottom: 100vh makes it overshoot.
Dialog with animation and @starting-style.  From what I've found, @starting-style has no effect on animation and dialog.
Fancy Theme Toggle.  Modal/Dialog element using Animation/Keyframe.
Modal/Dialog element using transitions.  Three steps DIALOG, DIALOG[open] and @starting-style for transitions using discrete CSS properties.
Modal/Dialog element using transitions.  An Extension of the previous instance.  However, this time applied to a form as well. ISSUE: Padding causes the transition to behave awkwardly/stutter.
Using 1cap unit for LINE-HEIGHT. More Modal/Dialog element using transitions.
Following a tutorial on downloading image blobs.
Incomplete image feed.  ISSUE: Layout shift.
Addressing Layout Shift issues.
Scroll driven animation attempt
Image scroller that scrolls on button click.
Image scroller with a button for upvotes. The upvotes do nothing. On Focus, the outline of the button scales up a bit.
Timeouts and Mousedown to elicit different behaviour.  Losing .focus() on an element using .blur()
Attempt at Drag and Drop.
Eclipse using Gradients.
Gallery of images. Based on https://www.thepostchaise.com/
Markdown in HTML/CSS/JS using Marked and DOMPurify.
Gallery of Pictures based on deck.gallery

Click and Hold to Remove an Image.  Starting Style was useful for animating the Hold Indicator. 2023/1218.html was useful for the @starting-style example code.  2024/216.html was useful for the click and hold example and sources.

Expanding Cards on Click.  Based on a Twitter Thing I saw.  Animations and Transitions are clunky.  There's room for improvement in future iterations regarding the styling and accessing cards beyond the first.

Instagram Stories Lab.  I was unsure of how to do the stacking within the Grid.  Overscroll-Behaviour: contain;  is also useful for making sure that scroll actions for a given element do not extend to a parent element.
2024.lesson: Overscroll-Behaviour: contain;  is also useful for making sure that scroll actions for a given element do not extend to a parent element.

2024.description: Image Gallery with Lazy Loading. Scroll Driven Animation for progress bar at the top.
Image Gallery with Modal.
File Download Variations [Same Origin / Cross-Origin Comparison]
Writing Mode for Vertical Text. I couldn't get the pattern to repeat beyond the Codepen Example.
A page on a page with some filler text.
A page on a page with some filler text.  With grid and borders.
Calendar thing based on a codepen.  I used position sticky.
Calendar thing AGAIN based on a codepen. This time with data attributes for each day.
Calendar thing AGAIN based on a codepen. Data Attributes for Each Day. Random Number of Prepended Empty spaces and a corresponding number of ending empty spaces.  I used nested CSS selectors too.

Calendar thing AGAIN based on a codepen. Data Attributes for Each Day. I used nested CSS selectors again. Dates are accurate and not randomly generated.  Assignment for Date objects is copy by reference and not by value.

Calendar thing AGAIN based on a codepen. Data Attributes for Each Day. I used nested CSS selectors again. Dates are accurate and not randomly generated.  Assignment for Date objects is copy by reference and not by value.  Modal onclick of each day.  Better/Less clunky implementation of the Calendar.  Hit the off by one bug/mistake again.

2023.description: Styled article from Propublica.  Starting off with something simple.
Intersection Observer Attempt

A pedestrian form and list.  List scrolls to the bottom on submit.  Re-learned the difference between 'change' and 'input' for .addEventListener().  For the former, you only see the change after you lose focus.  Submission is prevented if the form is empty.
A typical landing page.  Colours inspired by Mailchimp.  Practice with the Pancake/Accordion Component.
Another landing page.  More Practice with the Pancake/Accordion Component. This time with a Nav.  Attempted CSS Squares with a radial gradient. It didn't turn out well.
Another landing page. This time with an Image Scroller.

2023.lesson: Rename Custom CSS property from --PADDING to --SPACING.  Practice more with Custom CSS properties for faster color theming.

2023.description: Graphs using Chart.js. Using chart.js for the first time in awhile.  An attempt at making a graph dashboard.  It does not handle changing from mobile to desktop and vice-versa well.  You need to refresh the page or the graphs get all squashed, which may have been addressed by setting the height to 100% for the mobile view..  On the bright side, I got the labels for the axes to work quickly
Graphs using Chart.js. Scroll Snap with Bumpers was implemented.
2023.lesson: This was for more practice with Chart.js as well as the scroll bumpers. The background pseudo elements (green and purple circles) wouldn't go behind existing elements until i set their z-index values to -1. It didn't work if I merely set the value to some value less than its parent z-index value.

2023.description: Graphs using Chart.js. Line Graphs.  Configuration of the graphs is a drag.
A bar graph using Chart.js and local json file data.  Has Title, X-Axis, Y-Axis.

Scroll Snap list with addition of an element on scroll end.  However, the appended elements are all the same.  Scroll bumper at the beginning of the list.  No bumper at the end because each scroll event to the right adds a new element. Used picsum.photos for the randomly generated images.
2023.lesson: Add a tabindex=-1 value to be able to focus a non-input element on load.  document.activeElement to find what element has the current focus.

2023.description: Scroll Snap landing page with Scroll Bumpers.
Transitions and Animations

Gradient Practice.  Radial, Conic, Linear with and without Colour Stops.
More Gradient Practice.  Continuing from Yesterday.
Lazy Loading Content with Scroll Listener.

Lazy Loading Content, this time Images, with Scroll Listener.  ISSUE: I tried to get scroll snapping to work whilst appending the images but it made the appended elements not show up. ISSUE: On the body tag, if you use a radial-gradient and you don't want it to repeat and you set a min-block-size value, then you also need to use background-attachment: fixed.
2023.lesson: Scroll Snapping may not work with Lazy Loading.  On the body tag, if you use a radial-gradient and you don't want it to repeat and you set a min-block-size value, then you also need to use background-attachment: fixed.

2023.description: Lazy Loading Images using IntersectionObserver and Text Offset. ISSUE: Radial Gradient without colour stops did not work on the BODY element.
Styled Reddit Data.  Scroll Bumpers. Tightening of Hero Text.  Radial Gradient background.
Making Images with Text on Them.
Landing page based on the Stripe Landing page. ISSUE: I couldn't get the clip-path to work to create the weird assymetrical shape to work.
Another Landing Page.  Has Theme Toggle. Has Gradient Text.  ISSUE: -webkit-background-clip: text is vendor prefixed.
Circles on Click.  Trailing divs on cursor move.
Masks for text.  ISSUE: It seems mask-image is vendor prefixed in chrome but not in other browsers.

More masks and scroll to REFRESH. ISSUE: Overscroll-y and Scroll Snap did not work with window.addEventListener('scroll', func). ISSUE: Added scroll to the top to refresh, but it didn't work when the window was shrunk down, only when it was fully expanded.  And then, it worked in both cases.
More masks to augment images.
Stories Attempt 1.

Stories Attempt 2.  Attempted Scrolling after 3 seconds and pictures autogenerated from Lorem Picsum.  ISSUE: On the previous attempt I missed a container for the absolute positioned timer bar at the top.  I opted to try again instead of adjusting the styling.
Strings to SHA256 Hashes.
Horizontal Slides with Gradients and a Gradient with a Mask.

Auto scrolling images from picsum.photos with a timer at the top. ISSUE: I had to use animation-delay for the dynamically loaded ones.  I also attempted pausing and resuming the animations but the animation-delay worked better.
Timeline with Images. Not Responsive.
LeafletJS Tutorial

Dribbble clone.  Uses Scroll Snapping. Lazy loading onscroll.  Uses Dialog HTML tag for the modal.  Uses Lorem Picsum for photos. ISSUE: full screen of the dialog tag performs oddly, so you have to set the max-width and max-height values in order to back the background to fill the screen.  ISSUE: The image clicked on does not result in the image that appears in the modal.

Fade In Checkboxes with Staggered delay.  ISSUE: Not entirely what I set out to accomplish but I guess it's acceptable. ISSUE: also I found out that I was using putting the animation-delay value in the animation shorthand css incorrectly.  It's easier to understand if I just use animation-delay explicitly.
Netflix Data.  Converted JSON from CSV.
Conic Gradient Timer

Conic Gradient Timer again. Mask Image to obscure the ones at the end.  Disappearing text with timeouts. ISSUE: Had to look up how to keep things scrolled to the bottom of the list.  Dynamic timeouts done using el.style.setProperty(key ,value).

Netflix data with Tables and Lazy Loading.  ISSUE: Lazy loading doesn't work when the desktop window is fully maximized, but it does work when it's not, but that's because I copied the code incorrectly from the reference. Floating Action bar at the bottom right to scroll to the top.

Todo List.  ISSUE: StackOverflow Link for getting the checked value. ISSUE: MDN for setting style property using JS.  ISSUE: Scrolling to the bottom of a full list from StackOverflow, which I've forgotten how to do again. ISSUE: HTMLHEL.dev was useful for the tabbed outline for the text input, input radio and input submit.  The 'outline-offset': 2px value was particularly useful. TIME: 2hrs.
Netflix Data again, but this time with Summary Data.

Another TODO List. Started on 22 but done on 24. Two Categories.  ISSUE: Was going to add the auto remove feature after X Time but didn't. ISSUE: Completed Todos also don't end up in the Done Category. ISSUE: No dummy TODOs on load.
An redesign of the index.html page.
Using Fieldset, Legend and External CSS Sheets.

Using Scroll on Submit + (Fieldset, Legend and Form).  There are also scroll bumpers and appending an element as a sibling.  ISSUE: I forgot how to scroll on submit again and as I have named these prototype pages poorly, lost the reference on how to do it, requiring me to search for it, AGAIN.

2022.description: Shapes. Inspired by this mondrian codepen that I saw on generative art.  I do not recall the link.
Calendar with scroll snap again.  Done in around 90 minutes.  Numbers on Calendar are not placed in correct positions and months and day headings are not present or correct, respectively.

1d Scroll Snap.  Like a slideshow.
Calendar with nth-child(7n+1) and nth-child(7n+2) for the weekends.  Redraws the month on arrow key press.
Horizontal list with links.  On focus, drop shadow and an attempt at drag to scroll that failed to work.
Using Javascript to use Keyboard Shortcuts to make forms appear.  Uses 'Alt' and 'Ctrl'.
Blog post (1) layout with borrowed text and images.
Blog post (2) layout.  This time with a quote and centered text.  Issue: there is a horizontal scrolling issue that I can't seem to resolve.

Another Blog post (3) layout.  The above issue is min(65ch, 100%).  Attempts: Filters for images, Making the first letter of a paragraph larger, Pretentious elements, that serve no purpose, after the images.
Another blog post (4) layout. The sizing on the right is larger than on the left.
Modal that doesn't scroll have the background scroll when visible. Shortcuts (Ctrl + Space Bar) to make a modal appear.
Mobile-friendly Masonry (1) layout with some images.
Horizontal Media Bar (1).  Semi-Mobile-friendly.  Failed attempt at Drag and Drop.
Another Blog post layout (5).  This time with side by side images that are semi-responsive.
Conic gradient border, with text inside.  It's pretty bad.
The media bar from a BookStore UI. I couldn't really get the image to extend outside of its container.  Drop shadow on the image wasn't great either.
Just a mediocre list, copies Polygon.
A table of contents of a book in 'Holy Grail' layout.
Scroll left to right with drag and drop and scroll-snap.  Uses 'holy grail' layout.
Masonry Layout.  Used grid-auto-flow: dense for a tightly packed layout.  Based on the Brave News feature in the Brave browser.  Used the Repeat Auto-fit Minmax pattern from web.dev.

Checkbox to toggle between English and French for an article.  The toggle button needs work and the label needs to be centered with the toggle. Used the :checked pseudo selector for the checkbox and appearance none to make my own checkbox toggle.  Also, I had to look up how to change the css with javascript again.  I also had to lookup how to mitigate the security issue with target=_blank when opening anchors in a new tab.

Theme Toggle from a tutorial.  The Sun works but I couldn't get the Moon and transition to work.  The CSS they're using is beyond me at the moment.  More specifically, I don't really have a handle on @supports, @nest variants and :is().
A sort of responsive layout of the XBox Series X|S UI Layout.  The 2 column tiles don't maintain their aspect ratio  if the 2x2 pink tile isn't present.  I don't know why.
Book synopsis for 'How High We Go in the Dark'.
Failed attempt at 3d media scroller.  My understanding of radial gradients and masks is insufficient to be able to create my own.
Firewatch Marketing page.  An attempt at making an accordion.
Another marketing page with another accordion.  Responsive hero text though.
Another marketing page, this time: 'THE POX' with another accordion.  Responsive hero text though. And Working Pancake/Accordion Component.
Another marketing page, this time: OPEC oil with another accordion.  Responsive hero text though. And Working Pancake/Accordion Component.  Uses background gradients with blend mode.
Horizontal Slide show of three images, showcasing background blend mode.
Another horizontal scroller with an attempt at bounce effects whilst scrolling.
A login form. No HTTP requests, no Signup and no Email Recovery.
Another Marketing Page: Just practice with the Pancake Component and Centering text in the hero image.
Github contribution graph clone.
Another iteration of the Github contribution graph clone.
Slides, 2x2 with some components.
Github Contribution graph three.  This time split into two halves.
A todo list, and you can dismiss the footer.
An expanding image carousel.  Follows Tutorial.
Second iteration of expanding image carousel.  This time with my own code.
Another todo list. This time with the tasks disappearing.
Modal with a Dialog using backdrop-filter: blur.
A styled article with uneven margins.  Frosted background for Figcaptions.  filter: grayscale() for images.
Marketing page with a picture and some text. Menu that pops out from the side.  Backdrop filter: blur for the modal background.
Timeline with circles and dots
Expanding Image Carousel. With a Modal, on click, that has backdrop-filter: blur();
A Stopwatch.
Front End Mentor: QR Code Component.  [!] Something's off with the thickness of the text.
Front End Mentor: 3-column Preview Card Component.  [!] CDN Fonts wouldn't load during development. [!] The media queries for border radius were terribly irritating to account for.
Front End Mentor: Product Preview Card Component. [!] This one had a desktop and a mobile image.  I had to use display:none and media queries to get them to be mutually exclusive.

Front End Mentor: Stats Preview Card. [!] Used display:none and media queries to toggle between mobile and desktop image.  Omitted Tablet mode because I couldn't get it work.  The multiple filters applied to the image, sepia, hue-rotate and saturate.  I couldn't get it to match the provided image.
Front End Mentor: Digital Collectible. [!] Had to use hsl() to rgba() conversion because opacity applied to an element applies to all its child elements and you can't change it back.

Front End Mentor: Order Summary Component. [!] Changed font from 16px to 14px.  Header font-weight at highest setting doesn't look like the value mentioned in the style guide.  Hover state color for the Proceed to Payment button is not listed on the style guide.  It was estimated instead.  Drop shadow for the confirmation button and the Order Summary Card were also estimated since no appropriate value was listed in the style guide..

Front End Mentor: Huddle Landing Page.  [1] This took way longer than I wanted it to. [2] justify-self isn't a property that works in flexbox.  I had to use a <div> with aria-disabled=true to get the appropriate layout that I wanted. [3] I think SVG files can only be styled with CSS if used inline in an HTML document, not when included via img tag. [4] I think there are different .ttf files for different stylings and you have to include a different .ttf if you want the text italicized or bolded to varying degrees.
Front End Mentor: Form Signup Landing Page.
Checkbox toggles galore.
Theme toggle to change colour scheme.
Front End Mentor: Ping Landing Page.  Uses Validator for Email validation.  [1] You can use the attribute 'novalidate' on an <form> tag and it disables the default html input validation.
Front End Mentor: Testimonial Grid. [1] It seems you can adjust the positioning of a background-image: url() background using background-position: top 20px right 20px.
Front End Mentor: Advice Generator. [1] It was .removeChild() that was giving me trouble when doing setup and teardown with loading indicators.
Front End Mentor: Testimonials.  [1] Couldn't get the quotation text to runover onto the image of the person in the desktop view.  [2] Spacing is off in Mobile view.

Front End Mentor: Project Tracking Intro Component.  [1] Used a Pseudo component on the body element to get the oval in the background. [2] Used CSS variables for dynamic font-sizing because the style guide values seemed too small. [3] This was more difficult than I thought it would be.

Front End Mentor: Interactive Rating Component. [1] Had to do some guessing regarding the colour of the label for the choices. [2] I couldn't get the first choice to align with the left edge using flexbox's space-around property.
Front End Mentor: Expenses Chart Component
Front End Mentor: Four Card Feature

Responsive Image Gallery.  Creates a Lightbox when you click on an image. [1] uses backdrop-filter. [2] Resizes document.body on Lightbox appearance to prevent scrolling while lightbox present. [3] References local .json file for image addresses.
